revised_title: Matching Condition for Two-Dimensional Flow and Elliptic Cylinder Motion
tldr: The author investigates the two-dimensional flow at low Reynolds numbers, specifically the motion of an elliptic cylinder. They use a singular perturbation problem approach, finding a solution of the Stokes equations that satisfies the boundary conditions on the body and matches the outer solution in the matching region. The study provides an unambiguous result for the lift on an elliptic cylinder at incidence and demonstrates the relationship between two-dimensional flow and equivalent three-dimensional flow.
